naraitem.title: Portland Branch Evacuee Property Files
naraitem.creators: Department of the Interior. War Relocation Authority. 2/16/1944-6/30/1946 (Most Recent)
naraitem.from: Record Group 210: Records of the War Relocation Authority, 1941 - 1989
naraitem.functionAndUse: The Portland Branch of the Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco, in its role as program overseer, created and maintained these records to provide assistance in relocation, maintenance, and supervision of evacuee property during World War II.

findingAid.findingAidSource: NARA and the War Relocation Authority

naraitem.contributors: Federal Reserve System. Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco. 1914-, Contractor
naraitem.scopeAndContentNote: This series documents the management and disposal of properties and goods as identified by the War Relocation Authority (WRA) as directed by Executive Orders 9102 and 9066. This series consists of correspondence, reports, and case files pertaining to the property of individuals, families, and businesses impacted by involuntary evacuation and relocation because of their foreign national status or Japanese ancestry. Nationalities include, but are not limited to German, Italian, and Japanese. Subjects covered include internment, military restricted areas, Civilian Exclusion Orders, Wartime Civil Control Administration (WCCA), U.S. Employment Service, Farm Security Administration, National Council of Catholic Women, Tire Rationing Board, and the Japanese American Citizens League (JACL). Some of the records are in Japanese.

archivedCopies.extent1: 6,184 Tagged Image File Format (TIFF) files, 98 Portable Document Format (PDF) files, and 3 linear feet, 6 linear inches
archivedCopies.contacts1: National Archives at College Park - Electronic Records(RDE)
archivedCopies.countHoldingsMeasurement: 2 FRC Carton, Full Size, with Separate Lid
